alert.note: Alert for Avery; Burke Mountains; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:50PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell, southeastern Mitchell, southern Avery, east central Yancey and northwestern Burke Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 250 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spruce Pine, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Bakersville, Linville Falls, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, Bandana, Ingalls, Altamont, Ashford, Jonas Ridge and North Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Burke Mountains; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey
